text: Most of Seattle's roads have a layer of bricks under the asphalt/concrete. Becomes very evident when potholes go unpatched, or when new construction tears up the road.

@ MayorMemphis @ CVentura_WREG3 would love to see the potholes filled with RAC , Rubberized Asphalt Concrete. It’s a road paving material made by blending ground-up recycled tires with asphalt. Let’s try something different. http://www.calrecycle.ca.gov/tires/rac/
Repairing of road trenches & potholes with Asphalt Concrete at 5200 North Karachi pic.twitter.com/yYvA7kcgm5
